reviews.review_msg: AMAZING! David is by far the best prof in the English department. Take a class with him, it doesn't really matter which one, just take one.

Overall, Nilsson is a great teacher. He's attentive, respectful, and constant in the face of adversity. . . kind of like Griselda, actually. Hm. He does tend to ask questions a lot that are extremely obvious and it's almost tiresome to raise your  hand and answer them. Sometimes I wished for a bit more, more stimulation, deeper analysis in class.
She is a bit disorganized, but her interest is high. She is a great professor who is very good in one-on-one office hours.
Anne provided a lot of expert insight into Geoffrey Chaucer's works, making them very enjoyable. Her organizational skills however, need a lot of work.

Anne may be occasionally disorganized, but she's dedicated, interesting, and unbelievably helpful. I wish I had gotten the opportunity to take more classes with her. You definitely can't slide by though - know the material well and always read because she'll do pop quizzes on occasion.

A lot of people complain that she doesn't get assignments back on time, or that she doesn't put on a big "show" during lectures. These people missed the point -- you LEARN in Anne's class. You grow as a student with Anne as your lecturer and tutorial leader. If you want to just get a grade and go on to PDP, look elsewhere.

Anne is extremely dedicated to her students and will personally try to help you as much as she can -- which is rare. She is warm, intelligent, knowledgeable. She takes a long time getting marks back, which is a negative, however she makes sure you know your stuff in class and tutorial. She could be better at leading discussions.

I took English 306 - Chaucer with this prof! All I can say is..Thank God she wasn't also my tutorial intructor. Her lectures were sometimes almost completely irrelevant to the course material. If you like Chaucer, I highly suggest choosing DAVID COLEY as your prof. He's absolutely fantastic! - Cheers

Having Anne Higgins as a prof is like having a really lame aunt or mom as your prof. She is slow, disorganized, often goes on tangents, fuddy-duddy, has a lame sense of humour, and spends most of class time showing off her linguistics background. 80 or more percent of what we have to sit there and listen to is filler delivered sleep-inducingly.
Such a wonderful, lovely person, and absolutely brilliant!
made my required Chaucer class fun
If you actually love English as a subject then Matt as a professor is awesome. I see a lot of complaints about him being a tough marker, but honestly he's just fair. I thoroughly enjoy his class.

While I didn't care for the content of the course all too much, as a professor, he did as much as anyone could to make it interesting. I especially felt that he was able to make the synchronous sessions very welcoming and I felt comfortable speaking. However, he is a tough marker and in my opinion, some of his ideas were a bit vague. Solid prof!
